title: Ghost (monster class)
data:
The **ghost** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by a blank [space](/wiki/Space "Space") ( ). Ghosts are designated internally by the macro **S\_GHOST**.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The monster class contains two [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster"):[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

-   [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost")
-   [shade](/wiki/Shade "Shade")

It is [common for players](#Glyph_visibility) to use the [SYMBOLS](/wiki/Option#symset "Option") [option](/wiki/Option "Option") to give ghosts and shades a different appearance.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Glyph visibility](#Glyph_visibility)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 AceHack](#AceHack)
  - [3.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.4 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [3.5 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [3.6 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [3.7 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [4 References](#References)

## Common traits

All ghosts are [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid"), [human size](/wiki/Human_size "Human size") [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") monsters that are [unsolid](/wiki/Unsolid "Unsolid") and [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing"). They are capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") and [phasing](/wiki/Phasing "Phasing") through walls, and will [follow](/wiki/Follow "Follow") a nearby player to other levels. They cannot be [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide"), and are always generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").

## Strategy

### Glyph visibility

Many players consider the   glyph to be difficult to see. To mitigate this, one can change the "monsters" option in the [options](/wiki/Options "Options") file to take advantage of otherwise [unused symbols](/wiki/Unused_symbols "Unused symbols"). A default line looks like:

```
OPTIONS=monsters:abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ@ '&;:~]
```

One alternative is:

```
OPTIONS=monsters:abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ@8'&;:~]
```

which uses 8 for ghosts and shades. This makes them generally easier to see, especially when using [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") or other means of detecting monsters that would otherwise display a blank glyph unless you move the cursor over its square (e.g. using [m](/wiki/M "M") to cycle through visible monsters while [far looking](/wiki/Far_look "Far look")).

## Variants

Some variants of *NetHack* change the glyph used by ghosts for better visibility.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds one new monster to the ghost monster class:

-   [shadow](/wiki/Shadow "Shadow")

### AceHack

In [AceHack](/wiki/AceHack "AceHack"), this monster class is merged into the [wraith monster class](/wiki/Wraith_\(monster_class\) "Wraith (monster class)") to make them more visible to players. This is also applicable to [Nethack 4](/wiki/Nethack_4 "Nethack 4"), [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk") and [FIQhack](/wiki/FIQhack "FIQhack").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the ghost monster class uses the [dot](/wiki/Dot "Dot"), ., as a glyph. dNetHack also moves the shade to [its own monster class](/wiki/Shade_\(monster_class\) "Shade (monster class)") and adds new monsters to the ghost monster class:

- . [garo](/wiki/Garo "Garo")
- . [being of Ib](/index.php?title=Being_of_Ib\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Being of Ib (page does not exist)")
- . [priest of Ib](/index.php?title=Priest_of_Ib\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Priest of Ib (page does not exist)")
- . [garo master](/wiki/Garo_master "Garo master")
- . [Maanzecorian](/wiki/Maanzecorian "Maanzecorian")
- . [Blackbeard's Ghost](/wiki/Blackbeard%27s_Ghost "Blackbeard's Ghost")

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), this monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to avoid using punctuation for monster glyphs and make them more visible.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds a new monster to the ghost monster class:

-   [spectre](/wiki/Spectre "Spectre")

Regular ghosts can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into spectres.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds a new monster to the ghost monster class:

-   [spectre](/wiki/Spectre "Spectre")

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), the ghost monster class now uses the 8 glyph. SlashTHEM retains the shadow from SLASH'EM and adds new monsters to the monster class:

- 8 [shadow](/wiki/Shadow "Shadow")
- 8 [spectre](/wiki/Spectre "Spectre")
- 8 [poltergeist](/wiki/Poltergeist "Poltergeist")
- 8 [Blackbeard's Ghost](/wiki/Blackbeard%27s_Ghost "Blackbeard's Ghost")
- 8 [Elvis Presley](/index.php?title=Elvis_Presley\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Elvis Presley (page does not exist)")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 68](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L68)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2336](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L2336)

Ghost (monster class)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The ghost is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by a blank space ( ). Ghosts are designated internally by the macro S_GHOST.[1]

The monster class contains two monsters:[2]

  •   ghost
  •   shade

It is common for players to use the SYMBOLS option to give ghosts and shades a different appearance.

Common traits

All ghosts are humanoid, human size undead monsters that are unsolid and unbreathing. They are capable of flight and phasing through walls, and will follow a nearby player to other levels. They cannot be genocided, and are always generated hostile.

Strategy

Glyph visibility

OPTIONS=monsters:abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ@ '&;:~]

OPTIONS=monsters:abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ@8'&;:~]

which uses 8 for ghosts and shades. This makes them generally easier to see, especially when using telepathy or other means of detecting monsters that would otherwise display a blank glyph unless you move the cursor over its square (e.g. using m to cycle through visible monsters while far looking).

Some variants of NetHack change the glyph used by ghosts for better visibility.

  •   shadow
